item.title: My IfStatement Using Java
item.dc:creator: @dclawed dclawed
item.description:
@dclawed wrote:

[code]public class IfStatement {
public static void main(String args []){
int test = 3;

    if (test < 5){
      System.out.println("This is correct");
}else{
      System.out.println("This is false");
      
    }
}

}[/code]

I have created an if statement, you can change the number, if you put int test as 6, and keep if test 5, it will say “this is false”,because 5 is not greater than 6. You can try it the other way round, put int test as 5, and if test as 6, it will say “this is false”.

Thanks and enjoy,
Dclawed

Read full topic
